column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Det norske buys Marathon's Norwegian assets for $2.1 bln cash
column5: OSLO  June 2 Energy firm Det norske  has agreed to buy Marathon Oil Corp's Norwegian business for $2.1 billion in cash and has secured the financing needed to pay for its share of the $20 billion Johan Sverdrup field in the North Sea  it said on Monday.

column4: Det norske buys Marathon's Norwegian assets for $2.1 bln
column5: OSLO  June 2 Norwegian oil and gas firm Det norske agreed to take over Marathon Oil's  Norwegian business for $2.1 billion in cash  increasing its output by around 80 000 barrels per day  the firms said on Monday.

column4: Marathon granted variance to bring temporary cooling towers to plant
column5: June 2 Louisiana's Department of Environmental Quality said it granted Marathon Petroleum Corp a variance to bring temporary cooling towers to its Garyville refinery  the third largest in the nation.

column4: Humana sues Medtronic over Infuse bone growth product
column5: June 2 Managed care company Humana Inc  has filed a lawsuit against Medtronic Inc accusing the medical device maker of falsely representing its Infuse bone growth-stimulation product as safe and effective in spinal fusion surgeries.

column4: Merck immune system-booster effective in skin  lung cancer
column5: A highly anticipated new immunotherapy from Merck & Co Inc proved effective in patients with advanced melanoma as well as some with lung cancer or head and neck cancer  according to early-stage studies presented on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Nigerian stocks hit 4-month high after MSCI re-weights index
column5: LAGOS  June 2 Nigerian stocks  surged to a 4-month high on Monday after equity index provider MSCI increased the weight of Africa's biggest economy in its frontier market index.

column5: (Corrects headline to indicate Nautilus loss was tossed out)

column4: Supreme court declines to hear NYT journalist leak case
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday declined to weigh whether journalists have special free speech protections that allow them to avoid being forced to testify in government leak cases.

column4: RPT-INVESTMENT FOCUS-Big merger flops may stall Europe's stock market rally
column5: LONDON  May 30 Investors looking for big merger-driven gains on Europe's stock markets this year are having to temper their expectations after a number of multi-billion euro deals have fizzled out.

column4: South Korea polls widely seen as vote on handling of ferry disaster
column5: SEOUL South Koreans elect new local representatives on Wednesday in elections widely seen as a barometer of President Park Geun-hye's response to a ferry disaster in April that killed more than 300 people  most of them children from the same school.

column5: DETROIT Helio Castroneves and Will Power gave Roger Penske a sweep of the Dual in Detroit IndyCar races at the weekend  giving Motor City pride a shot in the arm.

column4: Pfizer to pay $325 million in Neurontin settlement
column5: Pfizer Inc has agreed to pay $325 million to resolve claims it defrauded insurers and other healthcare benefit providers by marketing Neurontin for unapproved uses  its second settlement over the epilepsy drug in six weeks.

column5: FRANKFURT/LONDON  June 2 Germany's Henkel  will buy three U.S. hair care companies for 270 million euros ($370 million) in cash as the household products and industrial glues maker aims to strengthen its business with hair salons.

column4: Seadrill signs $1.1 bln rig deal with Total
column5: OSLO  June 2 Offshore driller Seadrill  signed a five-year  $1.1 billion contract with Total  for work offshore Nigeria  it said on Monday.

column5: June 2 Stifel Financial Corp said its broker-dealer subsidiary  Stifel  Nicolaus & Co Inc  hired two financial advisers from UBS Securities for its Santa Rosa  California office.

column4: Worker killed at Suncor oil sands site in northern Alberta
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  June 2 A worker was killed at Suncor Energy Inc's oil sands site in northern Alberta on Monday while performing maintenance on a piece of heavy equipment  a company spokeswoman said.

column5: NEW YORK  June 2 For many single or childless individuals  the question of how to distribute their worldly wealth after they die is wide-open and complicated. A charity? Alma mater? Distant nieces and nephews? A cat?
